title: Latin America to the max
name: Latin America to the max
description:
A Map by Jfishe16

Alright, so I have only been to two countries in Latin America--so far.  I did live in Mexico for 4.5 months, and traveled as much as I could.  Costa Rica was a just-for-fun trip and had my favorite places.  In Latin America there is poverty and definately some heartache, but it is also a smorgasbord of culture.  Eat up and enjoy!

properties.name: Cancun, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16Cancun, MexicoOk, ok, I know what everyone is thinking; Spring break + natty light + girls going wild, yada yada. No, we sought out the more remote beaches and chilled there. Awesome water and very relaxing if you want it that way.

properties.name: Cozumel, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16I visited Cozumel when I was younger. I remember that there was alot of cheap silver and that I got bitten by a fish while snorkeling because my grandpa told me to feed them from a can of easy change. Thanks grandpa.

properties.name: Cuatro Cienegas
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16This place is really small, but has alot to offer. There are a bunch of lagoons spread out all over the place, some of which you can swim in. Then a short drive away there are a bunch of petrified sand dunes that you can climb all over. Also, we stayed in a hotel with AC (whoah) and had a party with a mariachi band and bbq and everything. Great fun. Oh yeah, and our bus got stuck in the sand and we got to stay an extra night.

properties.name: Guanajuato
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16guanajuatoI went to Guanajuato for the International Cervantino Festival. It was insane. I can\'t believe I\'m still alive-there were so many people crammed into this colonial city. One cool thing is that there is a tunnel system that you can walk and drive through. Also, they have lots of museums, including one of mummies. I thought this would be cool, but it was actually pretty gross. Muhaha.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Zacatecas
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16This would be my favorite city in Mexico. Not only is it not 1 million degrees in the shade here, it is pretty fun. It is colonial, so the architecture is nice. Also, there are some nice hostels, bars, and museums.

properties.name: Monterrey, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16Old MTY; I have a love hate relationship with this industrial giant. It is dirty, loud, and you can\'t walk anywhere without being yelled at-alot. But that mountain is freaking awesome, and some nights when I was on my roof looking at the city at night I didn\'t hate it. Buuttt, it would still take an act of God to get me back there.

properties.name: Puerto Quepos
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16Quepos is magnifico. It is located near some sweet whitewater, and, of course, the beach. The waves are great here-good for surfing. We didn\'t have any boards, so we surfed in our kayaks which was a little painful, but a blast. I suggest going when it is not tourist season because I heard from the locals that it gets very crowded.

properties.name: Saltillo
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16Saltillo is a small town about an hour from Monterrey. Really not alot going on here, except that you almost always have to stop here if you are on a bus going to or from MTY. Whatever you do, do not eat the enchiladas-or anything else-from the bus station here. This may seem like common sense to some people...

properties.name: San Jose, Costa Rica
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16San Jose, Costa ricaSan Jose is where the international airport is, so you almost have to go there. Don\'t bother staying for long, though; it is kind of ugly and dirty. A little scary, too. Costa Rica has too much beauty elsewhere to waste time in San Jose.

properties.name: San Miguel
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16I visited San Miguel for their running of the bulls, which is the second largest pamplonada in the world. It was pretty nuts. I learned how to dance cumbia and that micheladas are pretty darn good. I think I would have liked this pueblo better if it hadn\'t of been so wild; it\'s a friendly place for a tired traveler.

properties.name: Turrialba
properties.description: Posted by Jfishe16This place is great. It is pretty small and the people are welcoming. Things are cheap-especially the tasty food. The best part about Turrialba is its location. It is close to lots of mountains and rivers. Gorgeous.
